<a href="https://covid19.within.co/covid-19retailpulse/?utm_source=MorningBrew&utm_medium=Newsletter" style="border-bottom:none!important;" target="_blank" class=""><img alt="Within" style="width:100%;max-width: 97px; display: inline; vertical-align: middle;" width="97" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL2NvbXBhbnkvbG9nby8xOTEvMTU4NDQ3NDkxOC1XSVRISU5fTE9HTy0wMS5wbmciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJjb21ldC1tb3JuaW5nYnJldyIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19"></a>
</th>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top:20px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Good Tuesday morning. </strong>Some of you have commented we’re living in the Twilight Zone, which we’ve shrugged off until reading the following story: </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The bankrupt sporting goods retailer Modell’s has stopped its liquidation sales to comply with laws ordering merchants to close. What does that mean? It can’t shut down its stores because its stores are shut down. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You win.</p>
</td>
</tr>

</th>
</tr>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
RETAIL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/23/counts-essential-business?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Are You Essential?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Closed brewery" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zMzMvY2xvc2VkX2JyZXdlcnkuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Mario Tama/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, Massachusetts and Maryland <a href="https://www.bostonglobe.com/2020/03/23/metro/coronavirus-latest-updates/?event=event12&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">joined</a> states including New York, New Jersey, Illinois, and California in ordering all "nonessential" industries to close. By limiting in-person operations to “essential” businesses, like grocery stores and health clinics, state governments are hoping to enforce social distancing and curb the spread of coronavirus. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But these orders are also spreading confusion and setting nonessential businesses up to fail. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">According to whom? </h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Most “essential businesses” lists look pretty similar: food, healthcare, utilities, shipping, critical infrastructure.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But small differences between states could trip up attempts to quarantine consumers. New York and New Jersey deemed liquor stores essential, while nearby Pennsylvania didn't. Some worry thirsty consumers will hop across the Delaware River for another handle of Tito's, undermining containment efforts. Pennsylvania's governor is reconsidering the ban. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Some companies are still trying to figure out whether they're essential, like one California-based </span><span><a href="https://www.latimes.com/business/story/2020-03-20/coronavirus-california-business-closure?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">supplier</a></span><span> of radio equipment for first responders. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Others, like auto dealers, are struggling to </span><span><a href="https://www.autonews.com/dealers/dealer-confusion-grows-more-states-issue-stay-home-orders?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">parse out</a></span><span> which services they can still offer. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>GameStop and Tesla tried stretching the definition, but have since complied with orders and closed. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">To make things clearer for everyone, the U.S. Chamber of Commerce asked the White House to <a href="https://www.uschamber.com/letters-congress/us-chamber-letter-the-president-essential-infrastructure-and-essential-businesses?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">further clarify</a> which businesses are considered “essential.” The chamber wants banks, hardware stores, taxis, laundromats, plumbers, gas stations, and more to fall under the umbrella.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">The industry you're really curious about</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Marijuana dispensaries have gone from illegal to essential in lightning speed. Many states are keeping medical and/or recreational facilities open, and some are <a href="https://www.forbes.com/sites/tomangell/2020/03/23/coronavirus-crisis-shows-marijuana-is-essential-and-mainstream/#7002a3394db2?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">relaxing rules</a> to help customers stock up safely through home delivery, curbside pickups, and telemedicine. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Smart move: With tens of millions stuck at home with nothing to watch but </span><span><em>Planet Earth</em></span><span>, legal cannabis sales are </span><span><a href="https://www.usnews.com/news/national-news/articles/2020-03-20/coronavirus-pandemic-boosts-marijuana-sales-while-many-businesses-struggle?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">booming</a></span><span>.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The ones you didn't think about: </strong>Embrace those roots, because many states are <a href="https://www.usatoday.com/story/life/2020/03/20/coronavirus-hairstylists-making-house-calls-what-you-need-know/2870480001/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">deeming</a> hairdressers nonessential, which could impact up to 1.3 million establishments. Rules against large gatherings are forcing many churches to <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/religion/2020/03/13/millions-americans-no-church-sunday-is-coronaviruss-cruelest-closure-so-far/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">halt services</a>. And brothels in Germany, the Netherlands, and Nevada are <a href="https://www.chicagotribune.com/coronavirus/ct-nw-sex-workers-brothels-coronavirus-20200317-ft4wq6hczjh3fefwrsoomydste-story.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">closing</a> over health concerns. </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ECONOMY
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/23/jerome-powell-puts-chips-table?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Is That James Holzhauer or Jerome Powell?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Jeopardy" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=404 src="https://oslo-production.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/medium/asset/327/james_holzhauer.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Jeopardy" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://oslo-production.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/medium/asset/327/james_holzhauer.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The coronavirus dealt the Federal Reserve a 2-7 offsuit, but Chairman Jerome Powell has no choice but to go all in. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, the Fed said it would buy <a href="https://apnews.com/eac219fdb053191bceb521b0fe6b654d?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">unlimited government debt</a> and provide loans to businesses large and small in its most drastic move yet—a move that shows we're not wrong to use the words "staggering crisis" to describe the current state of the economy. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">What's happening: </strong>The Fed is building a "wall of money" to make sure credit is available when companies, states, and local governments need a lifeline, <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2020/03/23/upshot/coronavirus-fed-extraordinary-response.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">the NYT writes</a>. Investors have been selling assets and hoarding cash, causing financial markets to seize up and stop working. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">As part of its CPR kit for businesses, the Fed said it would roll out a Main Street Business Lending Program that'll allow small and midsized businesses to borrow money on favorable terms to meet basic needs like payroll and rent. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">With some of these programs, the Fed is stepping out of its traditional role. But, to blend a few phrases, desperate times call for the kitchen sink. </p>

<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2020%2F03%2F23%2Fjerome-powell-puts-chips-table" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">

</a>

<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
REAL ESTATE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/23/coronavirus-slows-real-estate-sales?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
A House Is Not a Quarantine
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Haunted house for sale" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zMzEvaG91c2VfZm9yX3NhbGUucG5nIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Public Domain Pictures</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Buying a house is currently the last thing on many Americans' minds. It's also getting harder to do. Because of coronavirus, brokerage Redfin is <a href="https://www.marketwatch.com/story/redfin-and-other-brokerage-firms-cancel-open-houses-and-limit-in-person-tours-as-social-distancing-hits-the-real-estate-industry-2020-03-17?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">canceling</a> open houses, limiting sizes of in-person tours, and restricting clients from entering small bathrooms. Re/Max also advised agents to pull open houses.  </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">According to the National Association of Realtors, members are noticing <a href="https://www.forbes.com/sites/taramastroeni/2020/03/23/national-association-of-realtors-nar-survey-shows-how-coronavirus-has-started-to-impact-the-housing-market/#67ef355681aa?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">significantly lower buyer interest</a> (in residential and commercial real estate) but most homeowners haven't pulled listings. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>"I have been in business for 40 years, and this looks like a cross between 9/11 and 2008," Manhattan luxury real estate agent Donna Olshan </span><span><a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/coronavirus-is-forcing-real-estate-agents-to-adapt-will-they-sink-or-swim-11584638483?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">told</a></span><span> the WSJ.  </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Virtual tours time to shine? </strong>More realtors are turning to 3D home models or virtual tours. But in a state under lockdown like California, new listings are hard to get up because realtors, stagers, and photographers can't commute to work. And as vets of the NYC real estate market, color us skeptical of pre-staged units. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Real estate is getting hit on multiple sides: buyers who can't come out to tour and a deteriorating economy tightening purse strings.</p>

</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">

</font></a>
</h1>

</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Man wearing coronavirus mask at Walmart" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC81Ny93YWxtYXJ0X2Nvcm9uYXZpcnVzX3Nob3BwZXIuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Tayfun Coskun/Anadolu Agency via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">While small businesses across the country are fighting for survival, some larger retailers are adding hundreds of thousands to their payrolls.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Let's start with small businesses. </strong>Scheduling software provider Homebase has been <a href="https://joinhomebase.com/blog/real-time-covid-19-data/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">tracking the effect</a> of social distancing requirements on hourly workers and small businesses, and...it's grim. Small shops are rapidly closing across the country.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://oslo-production.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/medium/asset/332/open_businesses.jpg" class="img-responsive" width="640" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;" alt="coronavirus"></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;line-height: 22px;"><small> <em>Francis Scialabba</em> </small></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The story for bigger retailers is the <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/coronavirus-sparks-hiring-spree-for-nearly-500-000-jobs-at-biggest-retailers-11584984596?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">polar opposite</a>. The appetite for staple goods and delivery is so strong they're hiring over 600,000 workers to meet demand.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Instacart: </strong></span><span>300,000 "shoppers" over the next three months. Last Sunday, downloads of the delivery platform's app were </span><span><a href="https://blog.apptopia.com/instacart-and-grocery-delivery-apps-set-consecutive-days-of-record-downloads?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">up 218%</a></span><span> over February.  </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Walmart: </strong></span><span>150,000 workers who will undergo a 24-hour hiring process </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Amazon: </strong></span><span>100,000 delivery and logistics workers</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">CVS and Dollar General: </strong></span><span>50,000 workers each</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Papa John's and Domino's: </strong></span><span>30,000 staff combined</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Kroger: </strong></span><span>10,000 workers across stores, distribution centers, and factories</span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Coronavirus has decimated some sectors, but many large retailers are greatly benefiting.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
HEALTHCARE
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/23/javitz-center-begins-transformation-makeshift-hospital?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Name That Building
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Javitz Center" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zMjgvamF2aXR6X2NlbnRlci5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Roy Rochlin/Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That temple of glass is NYC’s Jacob K. Javits Convention Center.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A month ago, it was hosting the 117th annual Toy Fair New York. Yesterday, it began its <a href="https://nypost.com/2020/03/23/cuomo-previews-the-javits-centers-overhaul-into-a-coronavirus-hospital-complex/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">transformation</a> into a makeshift hospital as the city’s healthcare system scrambles to treat 12,300+ coronavirus cases in the five boroughs. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">New York Governor Andrew Cuomo said the main showroom will be split into four, 250-bed hospitals. It should be <a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2020-03-23/n-y-s-javits-center-to-add-2-000-beds-to-system-under-strain?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">ready to admit patients</a> in seven to 10 days.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
PODCAST
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Your Crash Course in the Fed's Coronavirus Policy
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>

<img alt="art goldsmith podcast art " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zMzAvYXJ0X2dvbGRzbWl0aF9wb2RfYXJ0LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We did our very best to explain how the Fed is responding to the economic crisis. But sometimes...with a topic as important as this you just gotta call in the experts. Washington and Lee University economics professor Art Goldsmith is that expert. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">We invited him on Morning Brew's <em>Business Casual </em>podcast to explain what the Fed's actions mean for your day-to-day, from getting a mortgage to choosing a bank. He also gives a master class on how Fed policy works, why it exists in the first place, and what we can expect from central bankers as COVID-19 derails the business world.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">This may be the most important <em>Business Casual </em>episode yet. It's also a reunion: Goldsmith was <em>Business Casual </em>host Kinsey Grant's econ professor in college. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Listen here:</strong> <a href="https://link.chtbl.com/artgoldsmith_apple?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Apple</a> / <a href="https://link.chtbl.com/artgoldsmith_spotify?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Spotify</a> / <a href="https://link.chtbl.com/artgoldsmith_all?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">everywhere else</a></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"></p>
</td>

</th>
</tr>
</table>

<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Today's Daily Quarantine Planner is brought to you by Brew Editorial Coordinator Jamie Wilde. As you'll see, she's got some excellent taste.</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">
<img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/240/apple/237/weight-lifter_1f3cb.png" class="img-responsive" width="18" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 18px;" alt=""> Quick morning workout</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Let's do some yoga:</strong> Repeat <a href="https://www.verywellfit.com/illustrated-stepbystep-sun-salutation-3567187?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Sun Salutation</a> 5x, end in mountain pose, take five deep breaths, and set a simple goal for the day, like "brush my teeth before 1pm."</p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">
<img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/240/apple/237/earth-globe-europe-africa_1f30d.png" class="img-responsive" width="18" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 18px;" alt=""> Events happening in cyberspace</h2>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>TED Connects is </span><span><a href="https://www.ted.com/about/programs-initiatives/ted-connects-community-hope?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">going live</a></span><span> with hopeful experts weekdays at noon ET. Today, it's Bill Gates. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Diplo's </span><span><a href="https://www.instagram.com/p/B9-LMioHN0u/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">DJing</a></span><span> from home all week (again)</span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">
<img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/240/apple/237/headphone_1f3a7.png" class="img-responsive" width="18" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 18px;" alt=""> Work playlists</h2>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><em>Animal Crossing</em></span><span> OST + thunderstorm ambience on </span><span><a href="https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=K1SXrguBWRk&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">YouTube</a></span><span>
</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><a href="https://open.spotify.com/album/1UKlb2Lb7CW1trU8ultvGr?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Real Estate's</a></span><span> and </span><span><a href="https://open.spotify.com/album/31qVWUdRrlb8thMvts0yYL?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Tame Impala's</a></span><span> mellow new albums</span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">
<img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/240/google/241/bento-box_1f371.png" class="img-responsive" width="18" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 18px;" alt=""> Lunch break, but make it productive</h2>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Level up:</strong></span><span> </span><span><a href="https://www.freecodecamp.org/news/here-are-380-ivy-league-courses-you-can-take-online-right-now-for-free-9b3ffcbd7b8c/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">450 free Ivy League courses</a></span><span>
</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Do good:</strong></span><span> </span><span><a href="https://www.redcrossblood.org/give.html/find-drive?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Sign up here</a></span><span> to donate blood to the Red Cross. I'm signed up for Sunday, so let's peer pressure each other into keeping our appointments.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Stay up-to-date:</strong></span><span> We've been frequently updating our </span><span><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2020/03/16/morning-brews-guide-living-best-quarantined-life?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">guide to living your best quarantined life</a></span><span>.</span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">
<img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/240/apple/237/canned-food_1f96b.png" class="img-responsive" width="18" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 18px;" alt=""> Dinner plans</h2>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Expectation:</strong></span><span> Make kimchi fried rice. Here's my </span><span><a href="https://www.koreanbapsang.com/kimchi-fried-rice-kimchi-bokkeum-bap/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">favorite recipe</a></span><span>, but saute some bacon and garlic between steps 1 and 2.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Reality:</strong></span><span> Warm up a Costco croissant. Tear in half and stuff a square of dark chocolate into each side. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">
<img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/240/apple/237/television_1f4fa.png" class="img-responsive" width="18" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 18px;" alt=""> Evening activities</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">No screen: </strong>You don't need a feather quill to try <a href="https://thepostmansknock.com/faux-calligraphy-tutorial/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">faux calligraphy</a>. Once you get the basics down, you can build out a <a href="https://www.newyorker.com/culture/culture-desk/can-bullet-journaling-save-you?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">bullet journal</a> to add some structure to your socially distanced days, or just send your grandparents a nice letter.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Screen:</strong> There's a reason <a href="https://www.eurogamer.net/articles/2020-03-23-wow-animal-crossing-new-horizons-sales-are-through-the-roof?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">everyone's buying</a> the videogame <em>Animal Crossing: New Horizons</em>—you don't have to leave your house to hop on a Dodo Airlines flight. Set up your island, save up your Nook Miles, and come visit me. Here's my Dodo Code: 54SGT.</p>
<hr>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><em><img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/237/house-with-garden_1f3e1.png" width="18" style="max-width:18px" alt=""><strong data-stringify-type="bold" style="color:#000">We want you to live your best quarantined life</strong>—so much so, that we launched a brand new, free newsletter to be your guide. <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/the-essentials/?utm_medium=onsite&utm_campaign=dailyplanner_032020&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Check out The Essentials→</a></em></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"></p>

width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC8zMzMvY2xvc2VkX2JyZXdlcnkuanBnIiwiYnVja2V0Ijoib3Nsby1wcm9kdWN0aW9uIiwiZWRpdHMiOnsicmVzaXplIjp7IndpZHRoIjoxMDAwLCJoZWlnaHQiOm51bGx9fX0=\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eMario Tama/Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, Massachusetts and Maryland \u003ca href=\"https://www.bostonglobe.com/2020/03/23/metro/coronavirus-latest-updates/?event=event12\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ejoined\u003c/a\u003e states including New York, New Jersey, Illinois, and California in ordering all \"nonessential\" industries to close. By limiting in-person operations to “essential” businesses, like grocery stores and health clinics, state governments are hoping to enforce social distancing and curb the spread of coronavirus. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut these orders are also spreading confusion and setting nonessential businesses up to fail. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eAccording to whom? \u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMost “essential businesses” lists look pretty similar: food, healthcare, utilities, shipping, critical infrastructure.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut small differences between states could trip up attempts to quarantine consumers. New York and New Jersey deemed liquor stores essential, while nearby Pennsylvania didn't. Some worry thirsty consumers will hop across the Delaware River for another handle of Tito's, undermining containment efforts. Pennsylvania's governor is reconsidering the ban. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esupplier\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e of radio equipment for first responders. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eOthers, like auto dealers, are struggling to \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.autonews.com/dealers/dealer-confusion-grows-more-states-issue-stay-home-orders?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eparse out\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e which services they can still offer. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eGameStop and Tesla tried stretching the definition, but have since complied with orders and closed. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eTo make things clearer for everyone, the U.S. Chamber of Commerce asked the White House to \u003ca href=\"https://www.uschamber.com/letters-congress/us-chamber-letter-the-president-essential-infrastructure-and-essential-businesses?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efurther clarify\u003c/a\u003e which businesses are considered “essential.” The chamber wants banks, hardware stores, taxis, laundromats, plumbers, gas stations, and more to fall under the umbrella.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eThe industry you're really curious about\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp Rules against large gatherings are forcing many churches to \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/religion/2020/03/13/millions-americans-no-church-sunday-is-coronaviruss-cruelest-closure-so-far/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehalt services\u003c/a\u003e. style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe coronavirus dealt the Federal Reserve a 2-7 offsuit, but Chairman Jerome Powell has no choice but to go all in. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, the Fed said it would buy \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/eac219fdb053191bceb521b0fe6b654d?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eunlimited government debt\u003c/a\u003e and provide loans to businesses large and small in its most drastic move yet—a move that shows we're not wrong to use the words \"staggering crisis\" to describe the current state of the economy. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWhat's happening: \u003c/strong\u003eThe Fed is building a \"wall of money\" to make sure credit is available when companies, states, and local governments need a lifeline, \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2020/03/23/upshot/coronavirus-fed-extraordinary-response.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ethe NYT writes\u003c/a\u003e. Investors have been selling assets and hoarding cash, causing financial markets to seize up and stop working. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAs part of its CPR kit for businesses, the Fed said it would roll out a Main Street Business Lending Program that'll allow small and midsized businesses to borrow money on favorable terms to meet basic needs like payroll and rent. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWith some of these programs, the Fed is stepping out of its traditional role. It's also getting harder to do. Because of coronavirus, brokerage Redfin is \u003ca href=\"https://www.marketwatch.com/story/redfin-and-other-brokerage-firms-cancel-open-houses-and-limit-in-person-tours-as-social-distancing-hits-the-real-estate-industry-2020-03-17?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecanceling\u003c/a\u003e open houses, limiting sizes of in-person tours, and restricting clients from entering small bathrooms. Re/Max also advised agents to pull open houses.  \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAccording to the National Association of Realtors, members are noticing \u003ca href=\"https://www.forbes.com/sites/taramastroeni/2020/03/23/national-association-of-realtors-nar-survey-shows-how-coronavirus-has-started-to-impact-the-housing-market/#67ef355681aa?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esignificantly lower buyer interest\u003c/a\u003e (in residential and commercial real estate) but most homeowners haven't pulled listings. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\"I have been in business for 40 years, and this looks like a cross between 9/11 and 2008,\" Manhattan luxury real estate agent Donna Olshan \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/coronavirus-is-forcing-real-estate-agents-to-adapt-will-they-sink-or-swim-11584638483?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etold\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e the WSJ.  \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eVirtual tours time to shine? \u003c/strong\u003eMore realtors are turning to 3D home models or virtual tours. But in a state under lockdown like California, new listings are hard to get up because realtors, stagers, and photographers can't commute to work. And as vets of the NYC real estate market, color us skeptical of pre-staged units. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eReal estate is getting hit on multiple sides: buyers who can't come out to tour and a deteriorating economy tightening purse style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLet's start with small businesses. \u003c/strong\u003eScheduling software provider Homebase has been \u003ca href=\"https://joinhomebase.com/blog/real-time-covid-19-data/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etracking the effect\u003c/a\u003e of social distancing requirements on hourly workers and small businesses, and...it's grim. Small shops are rapidly closing across the country.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://oslo-production.s3.amazonaws.com/uploads/medium/asset/332/open_businesses.jpg\" class=\"img-responsive\" width=\"640\" style=\"width:100% !important;max-width: 640px; width: 100%;\" alt=\"coronavirus\"\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;line-height: 22px;\"\u003e\u003csmall\u003e \u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e \u003c/small\u003e\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe story for bigger retailers is the \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/coronavirus-sparks-hiring-spree-for-nearly-500-000-jobs-at-biggest-retailers-11584984596?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epolar opposite\u003c/a\u003e. The appetite for staple goods and delivery is so strong they're hiring over 600,000 workers to meet demand.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eInstacart: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e300,000 \"shoppers\" over the next three months. Last Sunday, downloads of the delivery platform's app were \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://blog.apptopia.com/instacart-and-grocery-delivery-apps-set-consecutive-days-of-record-downloads?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eup 218%\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e over February.  \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWalmart: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e150,000 workers who will undergo a 24-hour hiring process \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eAmazon: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e100,000 delivery and logistics workers\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eCVS and Dollar General: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e50,000 workers each\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003ePapa John's and Domino's: \u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e30,000 staff combined\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eKroger: style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003eCoronavirus has decimated some sectors, but many large retailers
